email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Desserts from the DoCSoc and CGCU Diversity Event
image.title: A selection of dessert canapes fom the diversity event last week!

email.text:
Hi everyone!
The past week was hectic with two major events: our joint diversity panel and networking event (photo of desserts above) with CGCU and Google DevFest London. Both events were great fun, and thanks to everyone who attended and helped out!
As the Department of Computing goes into December exams (or in the case of second years, their final week of Pintos), the next week will be quieter. Despite the super-short digest, we have some exciting things to announce, including a festive Christmas party, Pintos glasses and DoCSoc swag!
email.heading: Pintos Glasses
email.text: If you're a second year, join DoCSoc in celebrating the end of Pintos! We're handing out Pintos pint glasses at 7pm on Friday around labs. If you can't make it, don't worry! There will be another collection the week after (details TBC).
email.heading: DoCSoc Swag
email.text:
This Wednesday, DoCSoc's 2018-19 selection of branded swag will go online on the Union's online store, with DoCSoc hoodies (in black/yellow, heather/navy and burgundy/charcoal), T-shirts (mens and womens sizes available) and beanies (one size fits all, perfect for the winter!).
More details will follow in a separate email later this week!
email.heading: IC Hack 19 Organisers
email.text: With DevFest over (thanks to everyone who volunteered!), our focus is now on IC Hack 19. This year, we're back bigger than ever, targeting 400 attendees. With help needed in Logistics, Hacker Experience, Sponsorship, Marketing and more, IC Hack 19 is an opportunity to go beyond the standard role of a volunteer and become a _core organiser_ of a major hackathon. For more information, join the [DoCSoc: Operations](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1509850436007222/) group.
email.heading: DoCSoc Christmas Party

event.text:
Come put on your Santa hat and Christmas jumper, and join us for a night of festive fun! There'll be mince pies, Christmassy snacks, mulled wine, hot chocolate, and more. We'll also be playing some party games, so come get into the holiday spirit with us at the end of a busy term!
If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand.

email.heading: LSEG WIN Breakfast Sessions for Young Female Talents

event.location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London, EC4M 7LS
event.text:
**Limited spaces available!**
The **LSEG WIN (Women Inspired Network)** Community aims to provide a platform to celebrate female talents within and outside the Group. As part of the WIN Campus Taskforce, we’d like to invite a small group of elite female students from four top London universities (LSE, UCL, KCL, and Imperial College London) to attend our breakfast sessions to understand and explore the financial industry with the help of industry leaders and senior executives.
We are excited to offer this opportunity to young talented female students to help them to gain more exposure to financial markets, whilst networking with like-minded peers.
Our last breakfast session is **Alternative Career Options in Finance**, on Wednesday, 5 December, 9:00am – 10:00am. For more details, see the PDF attached.
Location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London EC4M 7LS
If you're interested, email DoCSoc at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk and they'll pass your details onto us!
